NPR published an article at 9: 33 a.m. EST in advance of U.S. President Donald Trump’s "Save America" rally on Jan. 6, 2021, and updated the headline as riots unfolded at the Capitol.
The publication did not publish an artic: Trump Supporters Storm U.S. Capitol, Clash With Police” before the event occurred.
Social media influencer Breck Worsham cl: Trump Supporters Storm Capitol, Clash With Police” at 9:33 am ET, more than three hours before the building had been breached.
NPR confirmed that the original story: s headline had been updated to accurately reflect the turn of events on Jan. 6, and that this is their standard practice in a developing story.
